newsitem.title: GERMANY: Dresdner to maintain links with Degussa.
newsitem.headline: Dresdner to maintain links with Degussa.

text.p: Germany's Dresdner Bank AG said on Friday it would maintain its links with chemicals and metals group Degussa AG even after agreeing to sell its stake in the firm to utility group Veba AG.
"We will maintain our excellent and longstanding connection with Degussa, which dates back to 1885," Dresdner chairman Juergen Sarrazin told the annual general meeting.
"It is important for us that Degussa is accompanying the transaction," he added.
Dresdner would invest the money generated from the sale to boost its internal funds, Sarrazin said.

Dresdner, Henkel KGaA and Muenchener Rueckversicherungs AG, this week agreed to sell their jointly-held stake of 36.4 percent in Degussa to Veba for 2.9 billion marks, of which Dresdner will earn 800 million marks.
The deal, which has been welcomed by Degussa, is subject to cartel office approval.
